record.title: ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, MAY 17, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m. Thursday, May 17; that on Thursday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate begin consideration of H.R. 2206, the Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act, as provided for under a previous order, with the time provided under that order equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
